about.title: About Me
about.intro: Technology interests me because it’s always evolving and there’s always something new to learn. I like how computer science combines logic and creativity — you can build real tools from just ideas and code. It feels powerful to understand how the digital world actually works behind the scenes.
about.focus: Right now, I’m working on improving my HTML, CSS, and programming skills. I’m also focusing on writing cleaner code and organizing projects better. These skills matter because they help me build more professional and scalable projects over time.
goals: Course: Develop a strong, professional digital portfolio in BEM1O
Career: Work in technology or computer science, possibly software engineering
Personal: Keep improving my problem-solving skills and stay consistent with learning

portfolio.title: Portfolio

portfolio.yearPlan: Throughout the year, I will update this page with new assignments, reflections, and improvements. My goal is to clearly show my progress and the challenges I’ve overcome.

projects.reflection: I learned about working with data, training models, and the importance of testing predictions against real results.

reflection.title: Reflection
reflection.intro: Reflection helps me understand what I’m improving at and what still needs work. By thinking about challenges and solutions, I can grow faster and avoid repeating mistakes.
reflection.skills: I track skills like teamwork, communication, organization, and problem-solving. These skills are just as important as technical knowledge because they help me work effectively on bigger projects.
reflection.subtitle: Each entry captures what I learned, what worked, and what I will improve next.
